publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1880 Elaine Thomson: Donside Paper Mill—That the Parliament congratulates the workforce, trade unions and management at the Donside Paper Mill in Aberdeen on their success in achieving an agreed solution to their difficulties in the form of a management buy-out and notes the importance of this achievement for the future of the paper industry in Aberdeen and throughout the rest of Scotland.
S1M-1880 Donside Paper Mill (lodged on 27 April 2001) Pauline McNeill*, Bristow Muldoon*, Brian Adam*, Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-1880 Donside Paper Mill (lodged on 27 April 2001) Irene Oldfather*
S1M-1880 Donside Paper Mill (lodged on 27 April 2001) Mrs Mary Mulligan*
S1M-1880 Donside Paper Mill (lodged on 27 April 2001) Mr Michael McMahon*, Hugh Henry*, Mr John Home Robertson*, Bill Butler*

S1M-1880 Elaine Thomson: Donside Paper Mill—That the Parliament congratulates the workforce, trade unions and management at the Donside Paper Mill in Aberdeen on their success in achieving an agreed solution to their difficulties in the form of a management buy-out and notes the importance of this achievement for the future of the paper industry in Aberdeen and throughout the rest of Scotland. Supported by: Pauline McNeill, Bristow Muldoon, Brian Adam, Tommy Sheridan, Irene Oldfather, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Mr Michael McMahon, Hugh Henry, Mr John Home Robertson, Bill Butler, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*
S1M-1880 Donside Paper Mill (lodged on 27 April 2001) Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Robin Harper*
S1M-1880 Donside Paper Mill (lodged on 27 April 2001) Nora Radcliffe*, Mike Watson*
S1M-1880# Donside Paper Mill (lodged on 27 April 2001) Rhoda Grant*, Maureen Macmillan*

S1M-1880# Elaine Thomson: Donside Paper Mill—That the Parliament congratulates the workforce, trade unions and management at the Donside Paper Mill in Aberdeen on their success in achieving an agreed solution to their difficulties in the form of a management buy-out and notes the importance of this achievement for the future of the paper industry in Aberdeen and throughout the rest of Scotland. Supported by: Pauline McNeill, Bristow Muldoon, Brian Adam, Tommy Sheridan, Irene Oldfather, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Mr Michael McMahon, Hugh Henry, Mr John Home Robertson, Bill Butler, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Robin Harper, Nora Radcliffe, Mike Watson, Rhoda Grant, Maureen Macmillan, Alex Neil*
S1M-1880# Donside Paper Mill (lodged on 27 April 2001) Andrew Wilson*, Mr Jamie Stone*
S1M-1880# Donside Paper Mill (lodged on 27 April 2001) Dr Richard Simpson*

S1M-1880# Elaine Thomson: Donside Paper Mill—That the Parliament congratulates the workforce, trade unions and management at the Donside Paper Mill in Aberdeen on their success in achieving an agreed solution to their difficulties in the form of a management buy-out and notes the importance of this achievement for the future of the paper industry in Aberdeen and throughout the rest of Scotland. Supported by: Pauline McNeill, Bristow Muldoon, Brian Adam, Tommy Sheridan, Irene Oldfather, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Mr Michael McMahon, Hugh Henry, Mr John Home Robertson, Bill Butler, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Robin Harper, Nora Radcliffe, Mike Watson, Rhoda Grant, Maureen Macmillan, Alex Neil, Andrew Wilson, Mr Jamie Stone, Dr Richard Simpson
